ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Ionospheric Connection Explorer (ICON) Hough Mode Extension (TIEGCM) Model Product Version 3

RevisionEvent.Note: Created Numerical metadata with DOI. JMW

ResourceHeader.Description: This data product contains the lower boundary of TIE-GCM including zonal wind, meridional wind, temperature, and geopotential height. Tidal structures obtained from ICON-MIGHTI observations are fitted to Hough Mode Extension (HME). Global tidal perturbation field are reconstructed using ICON HME at 97 km. ICON-MIGHTI winds and temperature from 94 km to 102 km in the latitude range of 10°S-40°N and SABER in the latitude range of 5°S-50°S are used to fit to the HME. To cover all local time for tidal analysis, ICON-MIGHTI and SABER data are accumulated with a 45-day window and a 60-day window, respectively. HME has been widely used and tested before, and detailed HME methodologies are summarized in Forbes et al. [1994] and Oberheide et al. [2011]. HME for ICON and application to TIEGCM simulation is summarized in Forbes et al. [2017] and Maute [2017], respectively, and sensitivity study of HME fitting to the data coverage can be found in Cullens et al. [2020]. These metadata include the model output data.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: National Aeronautics and Space Administration; Dr. Astrid Maute; Dr. Thomas J. Immel; Dr. Chihoko Cullens

PublicationInfo.Authors: Immel, T.J., Maute, A. Cullens, C.

InformationURL.Name: On the Specification of Upward-Propagating Tides for ICON Science InvestigationsN

AccessURL.Name: HTTPS from SPDF
AccessURL.Description: Access to ICON HME L4 data at the Space Physics Data Facility (SPDF)

AccessURL.Name: HTTPS from CDAWeb
AccessURL.Description: Access to ICON HME L4 data at Coordinated Data Analysis Web (CDAWeb) Data Services

Parameter.Name: Geographic Latitude
Parameter.Description: Geographic latitude (-south, +north).

Parameter.Name: Altitude
Parameter.Description: Altitude.

Parameter.Name: Missing Data
Parameter.Description: 1: Data is Missing, 0: Data is used for HME calculation.

Parameter.Name: Phase of Westward Propagating Wavenumber 2 Dirunal Zonal Wind Tides
Parameter.Description: Phase of westward propagating wavenumber 2 dirunal zonal wind tides. The “hours” in phase measurements actually are in UT. The phase is defined as the time when the maximum is observed at 0 longitude.

Parameter.Name: Phase of Westward Propagating Wavenumber 1 Dirunal Zonal Wind Tides
Parameter.Description: Phase of westward propagating wavenumber 1 dirunal zonal wind tides. The “hours” in phase measurements actually are in UT. The phase is defined as the time when the maximum is observed at 0 longitude.
